music

Class Chord

  • java.lang.Object
    • music.Chord

  • public class Chord
extends java.lang.Object
    The Chord class is used to store and manipulate chords, or groups of notes. Each chord is represented by a list of Note objects. Chord objects cannot be played directly using SoundPlayer but should be converted to PlayedChord objects instead.
    Author:
    Dev Chheda
    See Also:
    Note, PlayedChord, SoundPlayer

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.util.List<java.lang.String> romanNumeralChords
      A permanent list of the Roman numerals for diatonic chords in the Major scale.

        Parameters:

    • Method Detail

      • shiftOctave

        public Chord shiftOctave(int amt)
        Returns a new Chord identical to this one, but with each of its notes shifted by amt octaves. Positive valules of amt shift the chord up, and negative values shift the chord down.
        Parameters:
        amt - - the number of octaves to shift the chord by.
        Returns:
        A new Chord with all of its notes shifted by some number of octaves.

      • invert

        public Chord invert(int inversions)
        Returns a new Chord by inverting the current Chord<\tt>. This method does not accept negative inversions, or inversions greater than the size of the chord.
        Parameters:
        inversions - - the number of inversions to make on the current Chord
        Returns:
        A new Chord with inverted notes.

      • addNote

        public void addNote(Note note)
        Add a note to this Chord.
        Parameters:
        note - - the Note to add to this chord.
        See Also:
        getNotes(), getNotesAsArr()

      • getNotes

        public java.util.ArrayList<Note> getNotes()
        Get the notes of this Chord.
        Returns:
        An ArrayList<Note> containing the notes in this chord.
        See Also:
        getNotesAsArr(), addNote()

      • getNotesAsArr

        public Note[] getNotesAsArr()
        Get the notes of this Chord as a Note array.
        Returns:
        A Note[] containing the notes in this chord.
        See Also:
        getNotes(), addNote()

      • containsNote

        public boolean containsNote(Note note)
        Check if this Chord contains the given Note.
        Parameters:
        note - - the Note to check for.
        Returns:
        True if note is in this chord, and False otherwise.
        See Also:
        containsNoteIgnoreOctave(Note), containsChord(Chord), containsChordIgnoreOctave(Chord)

      • containsNoteIgnoreOctave

        public boolean containsNoteIgnoreOctave(Note note)
        Check if this Chord contains the given Note, ignoring octaves.
        Parameters:
        note - - the Note to check for.
        Returns:
        True if note at some octave is in this chord, and False otherwise.
        See Also:
        containsNote(Note), containsChord(Chord), containsChordIgnoreOctave(Chord)

      • toPlayedChord

        public PlayedChord toPlayedChord(int duration)
        Converts this Chord to a PlayedChord, which can be played using the SoundPlayer. Equivalent to toPlayedChord(duration, 80).
        Parameters:
        duration - - how long, in milliseconds the chord should be played.
        Returns:
        A PlayedChord with the same notes as this Chord and the specified duration.
        See Also:
        toPlayedChord(int, int), PlayedChord, SoundPlayer

      • toPlayedChord

        public PlayedChord toPlayedChord(int duration,
                                 int volume)
        Converts this Chord to a PlayedChord, which can be played using the SoundPlayer.
        Parameters:
        duration - - how long, in milliseconds the chord should be played.
        volume - - how loud, on a scale from 0 to 127, the chord should be played.
        Returns:
        A PlayedChord with the same notes as this Chord and the specified durationand volume.
        See Also:
        toPlayedChord(int), PlayedChord, SoundPlayer

      • containsChord

        public boolean containsChord(Chord oth)
        Checks if all the notes in a given Chord are also in this chord.
        Parameters:
        oth - - the other Chord to compare with.
        Returns:
        True if all the notes in oth are also in this chord, and False otherwise.
        See Also:
        containsChordIgnoreOctave(Chord), containsNote(Note), containsNoteIgnoreOctave(Note)

      • containsChordIgnoreOctave

        public boolean containsChordIgnoreOctave(Chord oth)
        Checks if all the notes in a given Chord are also in this chord, ignoring octaves.
        Parameters:
        oth - - the other Chord to compare with.
        Returns:
        True if all the notes in oth are also in this chord at some octave, and False otherwise.
        See Also:
        containsChord(Chord), containsNote(Note), containsNoteIgnoreOctave(Note)
